sentences.english: Lemons contain pectin fiber, which assists in fighting hunger cravings.
sentences.chinese: 柠檬富含果胶纤维，它又可以抵抗饥饿。

sentences.english: Worse than the hunger, say local leaders, is the thirst.
sentences.chinese: 但在当地头领看来，比饥饿可怕百倍的是干渴。

sentences.english: I think many people think suffering is dire starvation or poverty.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得许多人认为痛苦就是可怕的饥饿和贫困。

sentences.english: In the difficult times， many people died of hunger.
sentences.chinese: 在那限难时世，许多人因饥饿而死。

sentences.english: Deaden the gnaw of hunger that way.
sentences.chinese: 借此来缓和一下饥饿的煎熬。

sentences.english: Big Sheep and Small Sheep were tired, hungry and thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 大羊和小绵羊疲倦，饥饿和干渴。

sentences.english: It had brought nothing but drought and famine.
sentences.chinese: 除了干旱和饥饿，它无法带来任何东西。

sentences.english: Hatred does not stir the stone men half so much as hunger.
sentences.chinese: 憎恶不及饥饿一半的可能扰动石人。

sentences.english: There is a saying in China, "a bite when hungry is better appreciated than a feast when full."
sentences.chinese: 中国有句话叫饥饿时喂一口，胜过饱足时给一顿。

sentences.english: She snuffles, like a hungry horse.
sentences.chinese: 她抽了一下鼻子，就像一匹饥饿的马。

sentences.english: To dedicate a collective song to the fight against hunger in the world.
sentences.chinese: 为战胜世界饥饿的斗争奉献一首集体颂歌。

sentences.english: Demonstrating that the starved cells were not able to enter the VBNC state.
sentences.chinese: 说明经过饥饿后菌体不能够进入活而不长状态。

sentences.english: Then the grass-eating animals died of hunger.
sentences.chinese: 然后食肉动物死于饥饿。

definition: beset by hunger and cold (idiom)/starving and freezing/in desperate poverty
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
to starve to death/to be very hungry
hungry and thirsty/(fig.) to crave (knowledge, love etc)
